sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Labeling Machine for automated application of labels on pharmaceutical product containers including bottles, vials, and cartons.
sections.scope: Applicable to labeling activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the labeling machine is installed on a stable surface in a clean area.
Verify that all electrical and pneumatic connections are secure.
Check that label roll holder, applicator, and sensors are clean and functional.
Load the label roll onto the label holder spindle.
Thread the label web through guides, sensors, and applicator mechanism.
Adjust label guides and sensors according to label dimensions.
Set machine parameters including label length, speed, and dispensing position.
Perform test run with few containers to verify label placement accuracy.
Adjust label position, angle, or pressure if misalignment occurs.
Load containers onto the infeed conveyor or feeding table.
Ensure containers are clean, dry, and properly oriented.
Start the machine at slow speed initially.
Verify that labels are applied accurately on container surface.
Check for wrinkles, air bubbles, or incomplete adhesion.
Increase machine speed to production rate once accuracy is confirmed.
Monitor labeling process continuously for consistent quality.
Check label placement periodically during production run.
Verify label content, batch number, and expiry date printing if integrated.
Collect labeled containers and inspect for quality.
After completion, stop the machine and remove remaining label roll.
Clean label applicator and sensors to remove adhesive residue.
Document labeling parameters, batch details, and observations in the production record.
precautions: Ensure labels are stored properly to prevent adhesive degradation.
Check label alignment before starting production to prevent wastage.
Use containers with clean, dry surfaces for proper label adhesion.
Monitor label web tension to prevent tearing or misfeeding.
Clean sensors regularly to ensure proper detection.
Verify label content and artwork before loading.
Maintain proper machine speed to ensure quality application.
Segregate and destroy labels with incorrect information.
Follow line clearance procedures during product changeover.
